intro: Hoplophytum platzmannii, commonly known as the Cape dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and linear leaves. The plant is typically found in rocky, sandy, or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid regions. It produces small, oval-shaped fruits that are dispersed by wind. Hoplophytum platzmannii is adapted to drought conditions and is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
